Package domain

Class Sheep

java.lang.Object
domain.Animal
domain.Mammal
domain.Sheep
All Implemented Interfaces:
Unit
public class Sheep extends Mammal
The Sheep class represents a sheep that lives and moves inside the valley. It extends the Mammal class and defines specific behavior for the sheep: - Moves from north to south and back. - Recovers energy when reaching the edge or when near another sheep. - Dies when adjacent to a wolf.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sheep

      public Sheep(Valley valley, int row, int column)
      Creates a new sheep inside the specified valley at the given position. The sheep starts moving north with an initial energy value reduced through several steps.
      Parameters:
      valley - The valley the sheep belongs to.
      row - Initial row position.
      column - Initial column position.

  • Method Details

    • getShape

      public int getShape()
      Returns the shape type of this sheep. Sheep are represented as squares.
      Returns:
      integer value representing a square shape.

    • act

      public void act()
      Defines the behavior of the sheep for one simulation step. The sheep moves north or south depending on its direction, restores energy at the north edge, and dies if near a wolf.
